tool: # You can use any characters as id, except '_' because they are first parsed in params_extra and replaced by ' '. If you have no short keyword to define your extra argument list, you can try some hashing function on it like in the examples below.

# Currently, id for a tool should be in the table in an order ensuring that the first is the most specific. e.g. 'unique-coordinates-bed' should be before 'bed' else params_extra will output 'unique-coordinates- -k1,1 -k2,2n'. Think about an elegant solution.

extra: --sortRegions no --interpolationMethod nearest --heatmapHeight 10 --heatmapWidth 1 --missingDataColor 1 --colorList '#313695,#B6DFEC,#FFF6B1,#F67C4A,#A70226' --whatToShow 'plot, heatmap and colorbar' --legendLocation upper-center --xAxisLabel ' ' --refPointLabel 0 --samplesLabel CD34 EC LC SP4 SP8

--sortRegions keep --heatmapWidth 2 --heatmapHeight 9 --colorList '#313695,#B6DFEC,#FFF6B1,#F67C4A,#A70226' --whatToShow 'plot, heatmap and colorbar' --legendLocation upper-center --xAxisLabel ' ' --refPointLabel 0 --samplesLabel tCD34 EC
